cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles east of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn west-southwest toward the north-western Bahamas Tuesday–Wednesday, make hurricane-strength landfall along Florida’s east-central coast early Thursday, then arc northwest to north across the Florida Peninsula and into southern/central Georgia before accelerating northeast toward the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (roughly between North Palm Beach and Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Altamaha Sound, GA southward to Hallandale Beach, FL; Tropical Storm Watch Altamaha Sound southward to Volusia/Brevard County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from central Florida through the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (amounts could approach 4 inches late Thursday–Friday)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft surge possible near and south of Savannah entrance, especially at high tide)
weather_observation.wind: 20-25% chance of sustained 34-kt (39 mph) winds; brief tropical-storm gusts (40–50 mph) possible Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels with onshore flow Thursday night–Friday; inundation around 2–4 ft above ground possible in low-lying and tidal areas
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts, producing ponding and minor flash-flooding Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding at high tide, dangerous surf and rip currents, possible short-lived tornadoes in outer rain-bands during Friday
